text: The right question is, is still someone using less? (obv not considering a legacy app)
<@U6W3H6YN8> is there any chance to see the hubl extension for vcs ported also for the intellij suite?

<@UFH0PPMEW> the extension is open source, so all you need is some developers who are interested in that. If you want that you can literally port it yourself as long as intellij supports all of the same features
<@UD53A9UUR> interesting! I'm about to set up something similar.
may be worth you two collabing
Is there a way to _create_ modules locally, and upload them via the tooling?
create a directory with .module and upload to your remote.  it HubSpot will create the necessary files in that directory for you
mayhaps :slightly_smiling_face:
i am pretty early on and am not sure if i am going to end up with gulp or use webpack.  kinda leaning webpack to force me to learn it better

<@UD53A9UUR> for gulp or webpack depends which is your goal :slightly_smiling_face:

Actually i’m using webpack only for the js and gulp for the scss
noted.  just considering using webpack to force me to learn it better
yeah, you’re right
Cool! Is there a page that documents this?
Nice, atm it’s the base for the major js framework
I’d encourage even forking the original as it’d give people a route to discover the intellij version
Yeah, but atm I don’t have time to look into this, and won’t spend a lot of time as I’m working on HubSpot only for one of our company clients
ahh
i dont think so.
i just tried and it worked :slightly_smiling_face:

Hello
<@UH8USUDNF> here!
I want to help everyone's HubSpot project!

quick question on the local hubl server (tried searching first): does the server work with the new .module format? the examples in there are .json files and I keep getting an error if I start it without a custom-modules folder
apologies if this has been asked before!
fun fact <@UH3RC6KQX> -- when you push a change to the module locally to the HubSpot server, it will render in the dm live preview
pretty cool
doesnt answer your question, but thought may be helpful
oh that is pretty cool :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U26BLKGE4> would you know about this?
maybe <@U6W3H6YN8>?
follow-up question, are .json modules actually any different from .module modules? can we create them with the design manager?

Whenever I'm working with modules locally I usually create it in HubSpot then bring it down using FTP to work with it. As far as I know it does not use a .module structure, but rather a standard file structure including html, css, and js files in addition to fields.json and meta.json
The currently published version of the local server does not support the .module format

The .json modules have all the same data as the .module modules, it’s just that .module is easier to work with since it splits out your html/js/css/etc into separate files rather than as text properties in a json object
thanks for the response! cool to hear there aren't any other limitations of the .json modules
Well if you were hoping to upload json modules via FTP then you’d have some issues (since FTP expects the .module format)
oh gotcha

<@UEKMY50SU> what kind of issues have people reported? I've never had a problem working with the json filetypes directly. Or are you talking about just uploading new modules?

Either way, <@UH3RC6KQX> I also definitely recommend checking out the VSCode extension for working with modules; the fields shortcuts are incredible: <https://github.com/williamspiro/HubL-Language-Extension>
I was just referring to uploading new modules
got it, was just curious. Thanks!
